info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 4:24PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER TO RETURN... An upper level storm system will move from southwest to northeast across the Panhandles late Friday night into Saturday. The precipitation is expected to start off as rain across the Panhandles Friday evening and then it will quickly transition to snow from north to south behind a strong Canadian cold front early Saturday morning. Snow is then expected off and on throughout the day on Saturday. There could be a brief window of freezing rain or sleet Saturday morning, but little to no accumulation of ice is expected. Snowfall accumulations may reach the 1 to 2 inch range in the Oklahoma Panhandle with up to an inch across the Texas Panhandle. Wind chill readings could be down to around 10 below zero from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. Temperatures are then expected to rebound into the 40`s for highs on Sunday. Stay tuned to the developments of this winter system by visiting our homepage at www.weather.gov/ama/. Or on Facebook or Twitter.
